books.title: Unlocking Android
books.description: Android is an open source mobile phone platform based on the Linux operating system and developed by the Open Handset Alliance, a consortium of over 30 hardware, software and telecom companies.

books.title: Android in Action, Second Edition
books.description: When it comes to mobile apps, Android can do almost anything   and with this book, so can you! Android runs on mobile devices ranging from smart phones to tablets to countless special-purpose gadgets.

books.title: Specification by Example
books.description: When it comes to mobile apps, Android can do almost anything   and with this book, so can you! Android runs on mobile devices ranging from smart phones to tablets to countless special-purpose gadgets.

books.title: Flex 3 in Action
books.description: With Flex 3, web developers at any skill level can create high-quality, effective, and interactive Rich Internet Applications (RIAs) quickly and easily.

books.title: Camel in Action
books.description: Camel in Action is for developers working with integration of any kind. This highly practical book introduces Camel and shows examples of how to use it with the 45+ supported enterprise integration patterns.

books.title: Taming Text
books.description: It is no secret that the world is drowning in text and data. This causes real problems for everyday users who need to make sense of all the information available, and software engineers who want to make their text-based applications more useful and user-friendly.

books.title: JBoss in Action
books.description: The JBoss 5 Application Server is a Java Enterprise Edition 5 application server that provides services that most enterprise applications need, such as security, transactionality.

books.title: Gnuplot in Action
books.description: Gnuplot is the most widely used program to plot and visualize data for Unix/Linux systems and it is also popular for Windows and the Mac.

books.title: Extending and Embedding Perl
books.description: Extending and Embedding Perl explains how to expand the functionality and usefulness of the Perl programming language and how to use Perl from C programs.

books.title: iOS 4 in Action
books.description: Written for Xcode 4, iOS 4 in Action guides you from setting up your development environment, through coding your first app, all the way to selling in the App Store.

books.title: Elements of Programming with Perl
books.description: As the complexity of web sites grows, more and more webmasters need to acquire programming skills. Naturally, such persons are inclined to learn Perl, the "language of the web.

books.title: Learn Windows PowerShell in a Month of Lunches
books.description: There are thousands of them so many that it can be nearly impossible to keep track of all the locations and settings you need to administer Windows effectively.

books.title: R in Action
books.description: The ability to interpret and act on the massive amounts of information locked in web and enterprise systems is critical to success in the modern business economy.

books.title: Android in Practice
books.description: R in Action is the first book to present both the R system and the use cases that make it such a compelling package for business developers.

books.title: The Cloud at Your Service
books.description: R, a free software environment for statistical computing and graphics, is a comprehensive, fully-programmable package that empowers developers and analysts to capture, process, and respond intelligently to statistical information.

books.title: Implementing Elliptic Curve Cryptography
books.description: Implementing Elliptic Curve Cryptography proceeds step-by-step to explain basic number theory, polynomial mathematics, normal basis mathematics and elliptic curve mathematics. With these in place, applications to cryptography are introduced.
